author: Teresa Xie, Steven T. Dennis
description: Crypto-friendly Senate Democrats moved closer to reviving stablecoin legislation sought by the industry after bipartisan negotiators agreed to assorted revisions, including tightened restrictions on money laundering, foreign issuers and technology companies.
title: Crypto Bill Poised for Resurrection After Democrats Hail Changes

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Jamie Tarabay
description: Hopes faded for a Ukraine ceasefire after Vladimir Putin sent a low-level delegation to talks in Turkey, while attention shifted to bids on Capitol Hill for fresh sanctions to bring the Russian leader to the negotiating table.
title: Ukraine Ceasefire Prospects Dim as Calls for New Sanctions Grow

author: Scott Carpenter
description: The Trump administration’s cuts to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the government-sponsored mortgage giants, may put a damper on the housing market as it becomes harder to obtain some types of home loans, according to a report from Bloomberg Intelligence.
title: Trump’s Cuts at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac May Slow Housing Recovery, Report Says

author: Enda Curran
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior economy reporter Enda Curran looks at the varying estimates of the cost for the Republican tax-cut bill. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Tallying Up the Price for Trump’s ‘One Big, Beautiful Bill’

author: Chunzi Xu
description: Ontario plans to borrow C$59.8 billion ($42.7 billion) to fund a larger budget deficit and spending on highways and other infrastructure, and expects more of it will come from foreign currency bond sales.
title: Ontario to Sell More Debt Abroad as Deficit, Spending Grow

author: Stephanie Hughes
description: Ontario’s budget shortfall is expected to reach its highest level since the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic as the effects of the trade war hurt economic growth.
title: Trade War Brings Ontario Budget Deficit to Near Pandemic Levels

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon has developed a draft architecture and plan to implement the proposed “Golden Dome” air and missile defense system, its spokesman said, as questions mount about the Trump administration’s ambitious project.
title: Pentagon Says It Has Crafted Initial Plan for ‘Golden Dome’ Defense System

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Kate Sullivan
description: US President Donald Trump has secured $200 billion in deals during a visit to the United Arab Emirates, according to the White House, including agreements involving artificial intelligence that will boost the Gulf nation’s technological ambitions.
title: Trump Touts $200 Billion in UAE Deals in Wrapping Mideast Trip

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is putting the home of Voice of America up for possible sale — the latest in a series of high-profile buildings placed on a list for “accelerated disposal” as it moves to reduce the government’s real estate footprint.
title: Voice of America Building Is Latest Federal Property Up for Sale

author: Jef Feeley, Sabrina Willmer
description: Lawyers for President Donald Trump argued to a Delaware judge that a suit against him by the co-founders of his Truth Social platform should be dismissed or put on hold because he has immunity from such litigation while in office.
title: Trump Argues Immunity in Fight With Truth Social Co-Founders

author: Alex Wickham
description: A Ukrainian national has been charged with three counts of arson after a series of fires at properties linked to UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Ukrainian Charged in Arson Attacks Targeting UK Premier Starmer

author: Hugo Miller, Jan-Henrik Foerster, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Klaus Schwab’s abrupt departure from the World Economic Forum, the influential organization he founded and led for more than half a century, has complicated carefully laid plans to persuade Christine Lagarde to assume the helm in a seamless transition, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: World Economic Forum Courts Lagarde as Its Next Leader After Founder’s Abrupt Exit

author: Ari Natter
description: Moderate House Republicans are lobbying House Speaker Mike Johnson to lessen cuts to several clean energy tax credits in the broad tax and spending bill prior to the GOP’s plans to bring it to the floor next week.
title: Moderate Republicans Lobby House Speaker to Fix Energy Credits

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the Trump administration will offer Syria initial economic relief by seeking a 180-day waiver to sanctions imposed by Congress, with the longer-term goal of removing the restrictions entirely.
title: Trump Will Seek 180-Day Waiver to Congress Sanctions on Syria

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Gresa Kraja
description: The Italian and Albanian prime ministers plan to hold their first high-level intergovernmental summit in Italy by the end of the year, according to a draft joint statement seen by Bloomberg News.
title: Italy and Albania to Host Summit and Deepen Defense, Energy Ties

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: France, Spain and Greece are pushing for mandatory age restrictions for users of social networks including Meta Platforms Inc.’s Facebook and Elon Musk’s X, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.
title: France and Spain Want to Impose Age Limits on Social Media Networks

author: David Voreacos
description: Ras Baraka, the mayor of Newark, New Jersey, could face a July trial for trespassing after his arrest at a private detention facility that would help the Trump administration’s mass deportation efforts.
title: Newark Mayor Baraka Could Face July Trial in Trespassing Case

author: Oscar Medina
description: The US said it will seek to block loans from multilateral lenders to Chinese state companies operating in Colombia.
title: US Seeks to Block Loans to China State Companies in Colombia

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court signaled it’s wary of letting President Donald Trump start to restrict birthright citizenship, as the justices debated how much power federal judges should have to block controversial White House policies nationwide.
title: Supreme Court Wary of Letting Trump Citizenship Curbs Kick In

author: Fiona MacDonald, Dinesh Nair, Matthew Martin
description: During his first 15 years at Qatar Investment Authority, Mohammed Al Sowaidi helped establish its US presence and scout opportunities. Now, as head of the $524 billion state-backed entity, he’s pledging to invest an amount nearly equal to the fund’s current size, as part of a major commitment by the Gulf nation.
title: Qatar’s Wealth Fund Plans $500 Billion US Push Over Next Decade

author: Sara Gharaibeh
description: Hamas said it freed American-Israeli hostage Edan Alexander based on an understanding with the US that humanitarian assistance would return to Gaza and negotiations to end the war start immediately.
title: Hamas Says Aid Flows Must Resume After US-Israeli Hostage Freed

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: An overwhelming majority of Canadians believe the country’s relationship with the US has permanently changed, as President Donald Trump’s tariffs and sovereignty threats spark widespread fury in the northern nation.
title: Four in Five Canadians Believe Old US Relationship Is ‘Over,’ Poll Says

author: Salma El Wardany
description: Libya’s capital has been gripped by its worst fighting in years, sparking fears the North African nation will be dragged into widespread conflict as the government cracks down on rival militias.
title: Deadly Clashes in Libya Risk Ending OPEC-Nation’s Relative Calm

author: Irina Vilcu
description: Romanians delivered a resounding anti-establishment message in the first round of the country’s presidential election rerun, propelling hard-right leader George Simion and Bucharest’s independent centrist mayor Nicusor Dan to a high-stakes runoff to be held on May 18.
title: Romania’s Election Rerun: What’s at Stake as the Far Right Rises

author: Sara Sjolin, Christian Wienberg
description: Denmark is exploring adding nuclear power to its energy mix, potentially breaking away from a 40-year prohibition of the energy source, according to the Nordic country’s climate minister.
title: Denmark Considers Ending 40-Year Ban on Nuclear Power

author: Sam Dagher
description: US President Donald Trump says he’s ready to ease sanctions on Syria. He won’t be able to do it quickly.
title: Trump’s Pledge to Lift Syrian Sanctions Faces Long, Complex Road

author: Taylan Bilgic, Mihir Mishra
description: India stopped a Turkish company from operating at its airports after Turkey voiced support for Pakistan during a recent conflict between the two South Asian neighbors.
title: India Halts Turkish Airport Firm’s Operations After Pakistan Row

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: The chair of the House’s tax-writing panel said the $30,000 limit his committee put on the state and local tax deduction is “fair” and lawmakers from high-tax states should accept it.
title: GOP Tax Chair Says SALT Lawmakers Should Take $30,000 Limit

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is deepening its review of more than $15 billion in grants and other support awarded by its predecessor for upgrading power grids and manufacturing energy technology.
title: Trump Targets Billions in Energy Grants for New Round of Audits

author: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard
description: President Donald Trump’s flurry of artificial intelligence deals during his tour of the Middle East is opening a rift within his own administration as China hawks grow increasingly concerned the projects are putting US national security and economic interests at risk.
title: Trump’s Rush to Cut AI Deals in Saudi Arabia and UAE Opens Rift With China Hawks

author: Jackie Davalos
description: A bipartisan pair of senators is reviving a bill to break the grip that tech giants like Amazon.com Inc., Microsoft Corp. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google have on the Pentagon’s cloud computing and artificial intelligence contracts.
title: Senators Revive Bill to Break Big Tech’s Grip on Pentagon Deals

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: After a series of high-profile setbacks in federal court, the Trump administration is threatening to escalate its immigration crackdown by unilaterally suspending habeas corpus, a foundational right in the US that allows people in government custody to challenge the legality of their detention.
title: What Is Habeas Corpus and Why Does Trump Want to Suspend It?

author: Erik Larson
description: The US Supreme Court is considering whether to allow President Donald Trump’s executive order restricting the longstanding concept of birthright citizenship to start taking effect while a lawsuit proceeds.
title: Supreme Court Hears Clash Over Trump Birthright Citizenship Plan

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany’s federal government will reap €33.3 billion ($37.3 billion) less in tax income in the five years through 2029, as the economy’s persistently sluggish performance saps revenue.
title: Germany Expects €33.3 Billion Less in Taxes on Weak Economy

author: Lucy White
description: The UK government is in talks with several countries about hosting so-called return hubs to receive failed asylum seekers, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to reduce the cost of housing them and cut a backlog of claims that need processing.
title: UK in Talks to Set Up Asylum Seeker Return Hubs Abroad

author: Manolo Serapio Jr
description: A Philippine court has nullified an earlier decision of a lower court to acquit former Senator Leila de Lima on a drug case, a fresh setback for one of ex-President Rodrigo Duterte’s critics who just won a seat in Congress.
title: Philippine Court Voids Acquittal of Duterte Critic on Drug Case

author: Matthew Bristow
description: Años después del acuerdo de paz, nuevas guerrillas extorsionan a productores de palma, arroz y petróleo en Colombia. “Sin seguridad, nadie invierte”, advierte un empresario.
title: Extorsiones guerrilleras limitan el desarrollo agroindustrial en los llanos colombianos

author: Philip Aldrick
description: An improved trade deal with the European Union would hand UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves £10 billion ($13.3 billion) in the Autumn Budget and limit the need for further tax increases, according to economists.
title: EU Deal Would Give Reeves £10 Billion and Cut Risk of Tax Hikes

author: Greg Ryan
description: Brian Shortsleeve is seeking to become the next Republican governor of Massachusetts, a state that’s facing acute economic pressure from the White House’s cuts to federal funding for universities and scientific research. He doesn’t want to dwell on that.
title: Massachusetts GOP Governor Contender Downplays Federal Pressure

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is considering reinstating quotas on imports of several agriculture goods from Ukraine, a move that could end trade relief for the war-hit nation.
title: EU Considers Reinstating Trade Quotas on Ukraine as War Drags On

author: Joao Lima
description: Portuguese far-right Chega party leader Andre Ventura was helped away from a campaign event after feeling unwell, just days before a snap election.
title: Portugal Far-Right Leader Feels Unwell During Campaign Event

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni’s government wants to ease the burden on middle-class earnings with another giveaway in the coming year, according to the economics chief of her political party.
title: Meloni Wants Another Cut to Italy’s Payroll Taxes in Next Budget

author: Kate Sullivan, Akayla Gardner, Skylar Woodhouse
description: Vice President JD Vance will attend the inaugural mass of Pope Leo XIV following the pontiff’s historic election as the first American leader of the Roman Catholic Church.
title: JD Vance Plans Return to Vatican for Pope Leo’s Inaugural Mass

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senators Elizabeth Warren and Jeff Merkley are asking World Liberty Financial Inc., the Trump family’s crypto project, to preserve records of communications with the Trump administration and to provide copies of communications regarding its new stablecoin, USD1.
title: Senators Seek Records on Trump-Linked Firm’s Stablecoin Venture

author: Beril Akman
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Turkey’s Erdoğan Emerges as Trump’s Peacemaker Proxy

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran has faced suspicion for decades over its nuclear ambitions and whether it’s developing the capability to fire an atomic weapon.
title: How Close Is Iran to a Nuclear Weapon as Trump Eyes a Deal?

author: Ott Tammik
description: Russia deployed a fighter jet in NATO airspace this week after Estonia tried to inspect a so-called shadow fleet tanker passing the EU-member’s economic area, Estonia’s Foreign Minister Margus Tsahkna said.
title: Russia Sends Jet as Estonia Tries to Inspect Shadowy Oil Tanker

author: Philip Glamann, Jing Li
description: Beijing has pushed back against a US decision aimed at curbing Chinese-made artificial intelligence chips, a first sign of discord between the world’s two largest economies since they agreed to a trade truce last weekend.
title: China Accuses US of ‘Unilateral Bullying’ on Huawei AI Chips

author: Jorge Valero
description: Top trade officials from the European Union’s member states expressed increased confidence that they can reach an agreement to dial back the US’s tariff hikes after the Trump administration struck a tentative deal with the UK and agreed to significantly de-escalate its conflict with China.
title: EU Trade Officials See Signs of Optimism for US Tariff Deal

author: Ilena Peng, Deena Shanker, Agnieszka de Sousa
description: Ultra-processed foods have made US diets among the least expensive — and the most unhealthy — in the world. The health secretary wants to change that.
title: RFK Jr.'s Quest to Make Americans Eat Healthier Will Be Costly

author: Rachel Gamarski, Fernando Travaglini
description: This week at a luncheon in New York filled with CEOs and investors representing a big portion of Brazil’s economy, Sao Paulo Governor Tarcisio de Freitas looked and acted like someone seeking higher office.
title: Bolsonaro Ally Woos Wall Street, Building Presidential Buzz

author: Enda Curran, Nancy Cook
description: The cost of Republican lawmakers’ draft plan for sweeping tax cuts weighed in at $3.8 trillion over the next 10 years in one official estimate. The reality is likely much higher, thanks to the use of budget and political tools designed to minimize the appearance of the fiscal hit, according to independent analysts including former Republican staff members.
title: GOP Tax Bill Seen Masking More Than $1 Trillion Hit to US Debt

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Andrea Palasciano, Arne Delfs
description: German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul said his country is prepared to spend 5% of its economic output on defense, committing to a goal pushed for by US President Donald Trump.
title: Germany Commits to Meeting Trump’s Goal of 5% Defense Spending

author: James Regan
description: The European Union must revamp its alliance with the UK, French President Emmanuel Macron said at the JPMorgan Global Markets Conference in Paris on Thursday.
title: Macron Says EU Must Reinvent Relationship With the UK

author: Satviki Sanjay
description: Indians are backing out of trips to Turkey and Azerbaijan, data from travel websites show, after the two nations issued statements supporting Pakistan during heightened conflict between the South Asian rivals.
title: Indians Drop Turkey Travel Plans After Comments Backing Pakistan

author: Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s former presidential frontrunner Calin Georgescu has endorsed far-right candidate George Simion in a last-minute push to sway voters just days before Sunday’s close run-off vote.
title: Banned Candidate Backs Romania’s Far-Right Presidential Hopeful

author: Patrick Sykes
description: President Donald Trump said the US might be getting closer to an agreement with Iran to curb the Islamic Republic’s nuclear program.
title: Trump Says US and Iran Are Closer to Reaching a Nuclear Deal

author: Jordan Fabian, Swati Gupta
description: President Donald Trump said India has made an offer to drop tariffs on US goods, as the Asian nation negotiates a deal to avert higher import taxes.
title: Trump Says India Offered to Remove All Tariffs on US Goods

author: Colum Murphy, Lucille Liu, Martin Ritchie
description: David Perdue, the new US Ambassador to China, arrived in Beijing to take up his post as the world’s two largest economies navigate a delicate trade truce.
title: New US Envoy Perdue Arrives in China as Trade Tensions Cool

author: James Mayger, Yoshiaki Nohara, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: US and Chinese trade negotiators met again for talks just days after a key truce on tariffs as officials from the world’s biggest economies gathered in South Korea to assess the weakened state of global commerce.
title: US, Chinese Trade Negotiators Meet as APEC Slashes Growth View

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: The US approved the sale of $304 million-worth of missiles to Turkey as the NATO allies work to strengthen trade and defense ties.
title: US Approves $304 Million Missile Sale to Turkey as Ties Warm Up

author: Akemi Terukina, Sakura Murakami
description: Holding longer-term Treasuries and importing Japanese cars manufactured in the US are among the possible bargaining chips for Tokyo in its talks with Washington over President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, according to the leader of a small but influential opposition party.
title: US Treasuries, Re-Imported Japanese Cars Seen as Trade Leverage

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Andrea Palasciano, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Top US and European diplomats are gathering in Antalya, Turkey on Thursday as the outlook dims for any major breakthrough in expected peace talks between Ukraine and Russia.
title: Ukraine-Russia Breakthrough Hopes Fade as NATO Diplomats Meet

author: Ray Ndlovu, Lucy White
description: Zimbabwean workers looking to migrate to the UK by obtaining care work are in a bind after Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s administration announced plans to permanently scrap visas for that category of employees.
title: Zimbabweans Escaping Economic Woes in a Bind as UK Scraps Care Visas

author: Alan Crawford, Misha Savic
description: President Aleksandar Vucic wants to reap the rewards of cultivating links with the MAGA movement.
title: Serbia’s Embattled Leader Looks to Leverage Trump Family Ties

author: Tala Ahmadi, Sommer Saadi
description: A new study warns elimination of “nom-dom” status might just cost the government more money than it brings in. Or is the fear overblown?
title: Could This Tax Overhaul Spark a UK Wealth Exodus?

author: James Mayger, William Horobin
description: China’s widening trade surplus with the European Union is fueling fresh concerns that the 27-nation bloc risks becoming a dumping ground for cheap goods in the volatile tariff confrontation between Washington and Beijing.
title: US-China Trade Clash Risks Making Europe Dumping Ground for Cheap Goods

author: Piotr Skolimowski, Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s presidential election will determine whether the country can restore the rule of law and remain a reliable partner in the European Union after nearly a decade of divisive right-wing populist rule.
title: Why Poland’s Election Is a Barometer for Europe’s Populist Wave

author: Robert Burnson
description: The Trump administration urged a federal judge not to pursue the return of alleged Venezuelan gang members who were deported to a notorious prison in El Salvador, saying the US lacks authority to get the men released.
title: US Says It Lacks Power to Return Migrants in El Salvador Prison

author: Joy Lee
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said Russia was ready to assist in an independent investigation into the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 after the UN’s aviation council blamed it for the tragedy.
title: Putin Tells Anwar He Is Ready to Help in Independent MH17 Probe

author: John Cheng, Iris Ouyang
description: The trade truce is not enough to ignite a rush into Chinese financial assets amid expectations of reduced policy stimulus and lingering uncertainty on a final deal.
title: China’s Investors Signal Trade Truce Is No Panacea for Markets

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: The Philippines has signed a defense deal with Germany to expand their cooperation in weapons, logistics and cybersecurity.
title: Philippines, Germany Sign Defense Deal to Boost Arms Cooperation

author: Courtney McBride
description: The Trump administration called its $142 billion defense deal with Saudi Arabia “the largest defense sales agreement in history.” Critics aren’t so sure.
title: US-Saudi $142 Billion Defense Deal Sparks Questions, Few Answers
